name: Sen. James Lankford
tweet_text: Four of the states in 1787 had impeachment clauses in their state constitution that specifically allowed impeaching a former official, but when they wrote the United States Constitution, they only allowed current officials.

name: Sen. James Lankford
tweet_text: ‚Äúwhen the President of the United States is tried, the Chief Justice shall preside.‚Äù (Article I, Sec 3, Clause 6)...‚Äújudgment in cases of impeachment shall not extend further than to removal from office, & disqualification to hold & enjoy any office.‚Äù (Article I, Sec 3, Clause 7)

name: Sen. James Lankford
tweet_text: The US Constitution outlines the basic process for impeachment and trial of the president, but it says nothing about trying a former president: ‚ÄúThe president‚Ä¶shall be removed from office on impeachment‚Ä¶‚Äù (Article II, Section 4)

name: Sen. James Lankford
tweet_text: I cannot support removing someone from office who is no longer in office. An impeachment trial after someone has left office is unconstitutional.

name: Sen. James Lankford
tweet_text: I believe we are called to work towards reconciliation and peace. In the weeks, months, & years ahead what will you do to help our nation reconcile? Will you talk about race in your everyday conversations, or will you wait for the next innocent life to be lost?

name: Sen. James Lankford
